description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects (e.g. UACMe ID of 41, 43, 58 or 65) Author: Nik Seetharaman, Christian Burkard. License: https://github.com/Neo23x0/sigma/blob/master/LICENSE.Detection.Rules.md
false_positives: Legitimate CMSTP use (unlikely in modern enterprise environments)
name: CMSTP UAC Bypass via COM Object Access
query: (process.parent.executable:*\\DllHost.exe AND IntegrityLevel:("High" OR "System") AND process.parent.command_line:(*\ \/Processid\:\{3E5FC7F9\-9A51\-4367\-9063\-A120244FBEC7\}* OR *\ \/Processid\:\{3E000D72\-A845\-4CD9\-BD83\-80C07C3B881F\}* OR *\ \/Processid\:\{BD54C901\-076B\-434E\-B6C7\-17C531F4AB41\}* OR *\ \/Processid\:\{D2E7041B\-2927\-42FB\-8E9F\-7CE93B6DC937\}* OR *\ \/Processid\:\{E9495B87\-D950\-4AB5\-87A5\-FF6D70BF3E90\}*))
